text:
When redirected, multiple response data's are gathered, and assertions and
post-processors just work on the top-level response data, which may not be the
data they need to evaluate.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
This is because the result contains the response from the first request (the
redirect response), not the final resulting page.

I will fix it getting each of the requests be stored as a sub-result of a "main"
result that will totalize -- containing the request from the first sub-result,
the response from the last, and the sum of all the sub-result time's.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
sonam.chauhan@ce.com.au

> the request from the first sub-result, the response from the last, 
> and the sum of all the sub-result time's.

Hi Jordi - Will your planned "totalize" functionality allow text-match 
assertions to be made against individual sub-results? You mentioned something 
about time, so I wasn't clear if the text output of each redirect would be made 
available. 

Just FYI, I needed to assert against the last redirect. I used a brutal hack 
in .../sampler/HTTPSampler.java - I just uncommented this line:
  res.setResponseData(redirectResult.getResponseData());

I was thinking that maybe a "proper" solution would be to let assertions 
address individual redirect sub-results (maybe using a drop-down list 
containing sub-result numbers from 1 to MAX_REDIRECTS)

Sonam

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
The thing is everybody (including me) seems to have the exact need you have: to
assert against the last redirect result. And that's exactly what my fix will
allow for.

If anyone ever comes with the actual need to test against the intermediate
results and it can't be easily solved by explicitly creating samplers for each
of the steps of the redirect, we'll analyse the need and find a solution for it.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Fixed. Finally had the LAST result serve as the acumulator, all redirect results
being sub-results of this one. (Instead of all results being sub-results of the
FIRST one as it was before). This is consistent with browser behaviour, which
after a chain of redirects will show the last Location value in the address field.

Excellent - Thanks Jordi. 
I look forward to this replacing my nasty hack. :)
creator: sonam.chauhan@ce.com.au
